snippet: Although the cause of death for a mayoral candidate in Clarksdale, Miss., remains unclear, an official says Marco W. McMillian was not killed by being dragged, burned or beaten.
abstract: Coahoma County, Miss, coroner Scotty Meredith challenges statement from family of  Marco W McMillian, candidate for mayor of Clarksdale, who claim McMillian died after being beaten, burned and dragged; Meredith holds that McMillian's injuries were minor, and had not caused his death; National Black Justice coalition has called for the Justice Dept to investigate the killing of McMillian, who was black and openly gay.

byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and ROBBIE BROWN
byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Clarksdale, and Robbie Brown from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: Although the cause of death for a mayoral candidate in Clarksdale, Miss., remains unclear, an official says Marco W. McMillian was not killed by being dragged, burned or beaten.

headline.seo: Coroner Disputes Family’s Account of Candidate’s Death
headline.main: Coroner Disputes Family’s Account of Mississippi Mayoral Candidate’s Death
headline.print_headline: Coroner Disputes Family’s Account of Mississippi Mayoral Candidate’s Death
